master.comparisonInAndOutNetworkBenefitText: See benefit summary (for in network and out of network) benefits
master.comparisonOutOfNetworkBenefitText: See benefit summary for out of network benefits
master.comparisonSearchCoverageLinkText: See if covered in this plan
master.comparisonFullBenefitsLinkText: View all benefits for this plan
master.coverageHighlightsTopic1Option1: Select any dentist you want, anywhere across the country. When you choose a dentist who is part of this planâ€™s large national network, you receive discounted rates only available to members. To see a specialist, you do not need a referral.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic1Option2: Select any dentist in our large national network. If you choose a see a dentist that is not in the network, you won't receive coverage, so it's important to stay in the network. To see a specialist, you do not need a referral.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic1Option3: Select a primary care dentist from the plan's large regional network. A primary care dentist can help you manage your dental care. If you need to see a specialist, you'll need a referral from your primary care dentist.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic1Option4: Select any dentist in our large regional network. If you need to see a specialist, you'll need a referral.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic1Option5: Select a dentist in the network to receive 100% for many preventive care services. If you choose to see a dentist outside the network for preventive services, your out-of-pocket costs may be higher.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic2Option1: Get coverage on hundreds of services including crowns, braces, silver fillings and more. Preventive care, including routine exams, cleanings and fluoride treatment is covered 100% in the network. In addition, expectant mothers get extra coverage for cleanings both during pregnancy and three months following delivery (benefit not available in all states). Oral cancer screenings are covered for adults age 18 and older.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic2Option2: Get coverage on hundreds of services including crowns, braces, silver fillings and more. Most preventive care, including routine exams, cleanings and fluoride treatment is covered 100% in the network. In addition, expectant mothers get extra coverage for cleanings both during pregnancy and three months following delivery (benefit not available in all states). Oral cancer screenings are covered for adults age 18 and older.
master.coverageHighlightsTopic2Option3: Get coverage on hundreds of services including crowns, braces, silver fillings and more. Preventive care, including routine exams, cleanings and fluoride treatment is covered 100% in the network.
master.providerSearchTabText: Select a plan to find a dental provider or facility that's in our network.
master.smileDirectDisclaimer: SmileDirectClub is available to members enrolled in a UnitedHealthcare Dental PPO plan that includes orthodontic coverage. Not all individuals are suitable candidates for clear aligners. These services are intended for individuals who have mild or moderat orthodontic needs.
master.summaryProviderSearchDescription: Find out if your dental care provider is in the network.
master.summaryTopic1Option2: Network dentists recommended, out of network dentists allowed
master.summaryTopic1Option3: Network dentists only, no coverage out of network
master.summaryTopic2Option1: Preventive care provided by a network dentist is covered at 100%
master.summaryTopic2Option2: Most or all preventive care provided by a network dentist is covered at 100%
master.summaryTopic3Option1: This plan includes an annual maximum which is the most the plan will pay for the plan year
master.summaryTopic3Option2: This plan does not include an annual maximum
master.summaryTopic5Option1: Yes, a primary care dentist and a referral to see a specialist is required.
master.summaryTopic5Option2: Yes, a primary care dentist is required. No referral to see a specialist required.
master.summaryTopic5Option3: No primary care dentist or referral to see a specialist required.
master.summaryTopic5Option4: No primary care dentist required. Yes, a referral to see a specialist is required.
master.summaryTopic6Option1: Referrals are needed to see a specialist
master.summaryTopic6Option2: Referrals are not needed to see a specialist
master.comparisonDisclaimer: This information does not replace your official plan documents. Please see your benefit summary and official plan documents for coverage details, including limitations and exclusions.
